alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:05PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sumner County through 1245 PM CDT... At 1203 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Braman, or 11 miles north of Blackwell, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential downpours, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Haven and Hunnewell. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
